title: When you know riot messed up with their rework on aatrox

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Aatrox when played Top. Statistics include Aatrox's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Aatrox Top is Strong or Weak Against.

body: In one day after aatrox's rework came out. His winrate has dropped from 49% to 38.14%. Making aatrox right now the 10th worst winrate of all time on a champion, beating release buggy lucian, who had a winrate 38.5 {{champion:266}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
http://imgur.com/a/mHk48

Play rate goes up, win rate goes down due to inexperienced players. Not the first time it's happened.

Yea perhaps still on the weak side, but the purpose of these changes were:

> Aatrox has other problems besides the dicey-ness of self-healing, and we’re taking this time to tackle some of those problems. Hopefully, we’ll come out the other side more comfortable giving Aatrox balance tweaks in the future.

So the balance team is not done with him yet. I think no longer taking damage when using Blood Price is a bigger buff than we all realize.

That is a well sounded arguement. However kindred, another champion who had a mini rework with his passive on patch 7.5(Same patch as aatrox) had an increase in play rate from 1.20 to 3.50% and yet his winrate is still well main maintained at 50%. It is clear that there is something wrong with aatrox, as even inexperienced players who play kindred keep him at 50% while aatrox on the other hand tanked to a 38% win rate.

Kindred's passive rework didn't change much at all, and was barely noticed by anyone, a change of pick rate from 1.2% to 3.5% is likely more to do with players who felt Kindred didn't fit the meta at the time before hand and feels that the change to their passive works out.

Aatrox went from 0.9% pick rate to 7% pick rate.
That's a far greater point here.
That's more people than just the few that play the champion before it fell off the boards picking the champion back up.
Kindred only had a spike of roughly double their usual pick rate, while Aatrox has had a spike of SEVEN times.
The room for error on statistical analysis is massive for Aatrox when you realise how big those numbers are.

You can't make an accurate analysis until Aatrox's pick ratio stablises, at which point his win/loss ratio will also stabilise.

He went from 0.5% to 2.15% play rate an increase of 1.65% A little more than kindred who has an increase from 1.28% to 3.67 which is a 1.39%  increase. Or 0.26% more than kindred. )  I think you might have been mistaken with it saying patch 7.5 as the play rate. If you hover over it says the winrate. (Got to be careful when looking at statistics Klavinmour) :)

The graph Gehirn linked says that Aatrox's pick rate went up to 7%.
No where on it does it say Patch 7.5
And if it did, you'd still be wrong because the line just falls short of the 7, which would mean either patch 6.whatever or patch 7.0

I'm simply working from the best possible given data, officially given data from Riot.

Either way, riot did decide to buff aatrox on the live server on 11th of March. Riot didn't really release any info about the buff until after they had done it. It looked strange why aatrox's winrate increased by 3% on that day. It shows that riot HAS acknowledged that the Aatrox rework was underpowered. The buffs aren't enough to bring him out of the gutters  but its nice they acted on it.

It's not even a rework, all they did was change his passive and take away his ability costs.
It's a bandaid approach to giving some life to a dead champion while an actual rework is worked on.
I guess they just wanted to cut away parts of him that made it harder to balance him, replace them with healthier mechanics and see the results after to buff him back up to standards. :o
Because all the noobs rushing to play Aatrox
some things were improved like his w others were made worse

His win rate only dropped because people are actually playing him now instead of the 5 Aatrox mains.

He didn't even have a rework, it was a minor update, his ult didn't even get touched at all.
Barely anything changed on him, and he's just as playable as he was the previous patch. (which is to say not at all, he was quite playable early season 5 when you could level 2 dragon and get early power spikes for the team)

His passive rework is what i think is what made his win rate drop so drastically. It's just a weird change that makes him look like a trydermere wannabe. It especially weird that his revivial passive was nerfed, when it was pretty under powered already.
